en_US.sync-auto-reschedule: Auto reschedule cards reviewed on other devices after sync
en_US.auto-disperse-after-sync: Auto disperse siblings reviewed on other devices after sync
en_US.disperse-after-reschedule: Disperse siblings after rescheduling (breaks Load Balance)
en_US.overwrite-manually-scheduled-cards: Overwrite set due date while rescheduling
en_US.steps-stats-warning: This feature will slow down the speed at which the old stats page loads if you have a lot of reviews. Are you sure you want to enable it?

reschedule-recent-cards.one: Reschedule cards reviewed in the last day
reschedule-recent-cards.other: Reschedule cards reviewed in the last %{count} days

en_US.flatten-all-decks: Flatten future due cards in all decks (experimental)
en_US.clear-custom-data-title: Clear custom data in all cards
en_US.apply-easy-days-specific: Apply easy days for specific dates
en_US.step-stats-disabled:
If you would like to see your (re)learning step statistics, you can enable them with Tools > FSRS Helper > Show step stats.

This graph will slow down the speed at which this page loads if you have a lot of reviews, so enable it with caution.
en_US.step-stats-subtitle: Statistics for different first ratings during (re)learning steps
en_US.step-stats-help-line-1: This table shows the average time you wait before rating each card the next time (Time Delay) based on your first rating of the day for each card in the deck (Again or Hard or Good or Lapse).
en_US.step-stats-help-line-2: It also shows how well you remember a card after each subsequent rating (after its first rating) on average.
en_US.step-stats-help-line-3: The subsequent ratings after the first ratings of all cards in the deck are gathered and sorted by ascending order of the Time Delay (not shown on the table) and are then grouped into 4 groups (Time Delay 1<2<3<4).
en_US.step-stats-help-line-4: The 4 groups are further split and assigned to whatever the first rating of the cards was (Again or Hard or Good or Lapse). Therefore, each First Rating has 4 groups of subsequent ratings (Groups 1,2,3,4).
en_US.step-stats-help-line-5: Average Retention rates (R̅₁, R̅₂, R̅₃, R̅₄) for each group of subsequent ratings and the Average Overall Retention (R̅) for the first ratings are shown. Based on this, the average stability for cards after the first rating of the day (Again or Hard or Good or Lapse) is calculated.
en_US.step-stats-help-line-6: T<sub>X%</sub> means that X% of the cards in this deck with a first rating (Again or Hard or Good or Lapse) are delayed by this amount of time or less till the next rating.
en_US.step-stats-help-line-7: Recommended (re)learning steps are calculated from stability and desired retention. The 1st learning step is based S(Again). The 2nd learning step is based on the minimum of {S(Hard)* 2 - S(Again), S(Good), S(Again Then Good)}. The relearning step is base on S(Lapse).
en_US.insufficient-learn-step-data: (data is insufficient, please keep current setting)
en_US.fsrs-stats-help-line-1: Studied cards: the number of cards with FSRS memory states, excluding suspended cards.
en_US.fsrs-stats-help-line-2: Total review time: the amount of time spent doing reviews in Anki. This does not include the time spent on reviewing suspended and deleted cards.
en_US.fsrs-stats-help-line-3: Knowledge acquisition rate: the number of cards memorized per hour of actively doing reviews in Anki, calculated as the ratio of total knowledge and total time. Larger values indicate efficient learning. This metric can be used to compare different learners. If your collection is very young, this number may initially be very low or very high.
en_US.retention-graph-help: Retention rate and review count over time
en_US.true-retention-help: The True Retention is the pass rate calculated only on cards with intervals greater than or equal to one day. It is a better indicator of the learning quality than the Again rate.
en_US.true-retention-disabled:
If you would like to see your true retention statistics, you can enable them with Tools > FSRS Helper > Show true retention.

This table will slow down the speed at which this page loads if you have a lot of reviews, so enable it with caution.
en_US.true-retention-mature-help: By default, mature cards are defined as the cards with an interval of 21 days or longer. This cutoff can be adjusted in the add-on config.
en_US.advance-inquire-text: Enter the number of cards to be advanced.
en_US.advance-notification-text-deck: For this deck, it is relatively safe to advance up to %{count} cards.
en_US.advance-notification-text-collection: For this collection, it is relatively safe to advance up to %{count} cards.
en_US.advance-warning-text:
You can advance more cards if you wish, but it is not recommended.
Keep in mind that whenever you use Postpone or Advance, you depart from the optimal scheduling.
en_US.advance-info-text: This feature only affects the cards that have been scheduled by FSRS.
en_US.advance-enter-number: Please enter the number of cards you want to advance.
en_US.flatten-inquire-text: Enter the maximum number of reviews you want in the future.
en_US.flatten-info-text: This feature only affects the cards that have been scheduled by FSRS.
en_US.flatten-warning-text: This feature doesn't respect maximum interval settings, and may reduce your true retention significantly.
en_US.flatten-enter-number: Please enter the maximum number of reviews you want in the future.
en_US.postpone-inquire-text: Enter the number of cards to be postponed.
en_US.postpone-notification-text: %{deck}, it is relatively safe to postpone up to %{safe_cnt} cards.
en_US.postpone-warning-text:
You can postpone more cards if you wish, but it is not recommended.
Keep in mind that whenever you use Postpone or Advance, you depart from the optimal scheduling.
en_US.postpone-info-text: This feature only affects the cards that have been scheduled by FSRS.
en_US.postpone-enter-number: Please enter the number of cards you want to postpone.
en_US.postpone-reach-max-ivl: Failed to postpone %{reach_max_ivl_cnt} cards because they had already reached the configured maximum interval.
en_US.remedy-no-hard-reviews: There are no reviews with a Hard rating in the selected range of dates.
en_US.remedy-confirmation:
%{count} reviews had a Hard rating between %{start_date} and %{end_date}.
These ratings will be replaced with Again.
The IDs of these revlogs will be stored in a CSV file in the addon folder to allow undoing the changes.
Do you want to proceed?
en_US.remedy-success:
%{count} reviews were remedied.
Please re-optimize your FSRS parameters to incorporate the changes.
en_US.undo-remedy-success:
%{count} reviews were restored.
Please re-optimize your FSRS parameters to incorporate the changes.
en_US.disperse-too-close: Due dates are too close to disperse:
en_US.clear-custom-data-confirmation:
Clear custom data in all cards?
    The custom scheduling of FSRS4Anki stored memory state in custom data.
    It is unused when you enable the built-in FSRS.
    Are you sure?
en_US.clear-manual-rescheduling-confirmation:
This option removes revlog entries generated by "Set due date" and "Reschedule cards on change" that immediately precede another manual or reschedule entry.

This action cannot be undone. Do you want to continue?
en_US.easy-days-date-already-added: This date has already been added
en_US.easy-days-past-date: Easy days can't be applied on past dates.
en_US.reschedule-browser-action: FSRS: Update memory state and reschedule
en_US.enable-fsrs-warning: Please either enable FSRS in your deck options, or disable the FSRS helper add-on.
